timeline.bodyText:
One more thing. Doesn't removal of line brake the java docs for this class (@Public so quite important)?
Replace {@link ContinuousFileReaderOperator readers} with full class reference?
timeline.author: pnowojski

replies.bodyText: Yes, but the actual operator type is now hidden in the factory, so I'd rather remove the reference at all and leave just plain "readers".
replies.author: rkhachatryan

replies.bodyText: I think a reference to the code might be helpful for some more power users. I would be also fine with referencing ContinuousFileReaderOperatorFactory itself, as that wouldn't explode the comment's length.
replies.author: pnowojski

replies.bodyText: IMO javadoc of public API shouldn't talk about the implementation classes at all, unless there is a need (here there isn't). And "power users" should be able to go inside the method and see the implementation:)
replies.author: rkhachatryan

replies.bodyText: Ok, in that case please update the java docs.
